ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It is a required course for everyone in Astro Department.

Well, this is required for astronomers, so I guess my recommendation won't matter. But at least for this semester, you'll be interested for sure in pretty much all the topics covered. You will care about them!

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It helps me to know the functions of AAS and NASA, which I otherwise know very little. It has little to do with my dissertation research though.

This seminar showed me a wide range of things to learn as an "apprentice" astronomer, ranging from how to get the most out of the resources available to astronomers, to how NASA operates and how to write effective proposals, to even how one's astronomy skills could be applied to working in other industries, should one choose to do so. A pretty comprehensive set of tools for my toolbox!
